verses.esv:
6   Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
7   Without having any chief,
    officer, or ruler,
8   she prepares her bread in summer
    and gathers her food in harvest.
verses.kjv: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise: 7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler, 8 Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
verses.niv: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise! 7 It has no commander, no overseer or ruler, 8 yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest.

verses.esv:
25   the ants are a people not strong,
    yet they provide their food in the summer;
verses.kjv: 25 The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
verses.niv: 25 Ants are creatures of little strength, yet they store up their food in the summer;

verses.esv:
24   Four things on earth are small,
    but they are exceedingly wise:
25   the ants are a people not strong,
    yet they provide their food in the summer;
verses.kjv: 24 There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise: 25 The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
verses.niv: 24 "Four things on earth are small, yet they are extremely wise: 25 Ants are creatures of little strength, yet they store up their food in the summer;

verses.esv:
6   Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
verses.kjv: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
verses.niv: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise!

verses.esv:
4   The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
    while the soul of the diligent is richly supplied.
verses.kjv: 4 The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.niv: 4 The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.

verses.esv:
6   Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
7   Without having any chief,
    officer, or ruler,
8   she prepares her bread in summer
    and gathers her food in harvest.
9   How long will you lie there, O sluggard?
    When will you arise from your sleep?
10   A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest,
11   and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
    and want like an armed man.
verses.kjv: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise: 7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler, 8 Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest. 9 How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep? 10 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep: 11 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.
verses.niv: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise! 7 It has no commander, no overseer or ruler, 8 yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest. 9 How long will you lie there, you sluggard? When will you get up from your sleep? 10 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest- 11 and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.

verses.esv: 8 But if anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.kjv: 8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
verses.niv: 8 If anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for his immediate family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

verses.esv:
4   The sluggard does not plow in the autumn;
    he will seek at harvest and have nothing.
verses.kjv: 4 The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
verses.niv: 4 A sluggard does not plow in season; so at harvest time he looks but finds nothing.

verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,

verses.esv: 7 rendering service with a good will as to the Lord and not to man,
verses.kjv: 7 With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:
verses.niv: 7 Serve wholeheartedly, as if you were serving the Lord, not men,

verses.esv:
24   Four things on earth are small,
    but they are exceedingly wise:
verses.kjv: 24 There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:
verses.niv: 24 "Four things on earth are small, yet they are extremely wise:

verses.esv:
8   she prepares her bread in summer
    and gathers her food in harvest.
verses.kjv: 8 Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
verses.niv: 8 yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest.

verses.esv:
7   Without having any chief,
    officer, or ruler,
verses.kjv: 7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
verses.niv: 7 It has no commander, no overseer or ruler,

verses.esv:
4   A slack hand causes poverty,
    but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.kjv: 4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.niv: 4 Lazy hands make a man poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.

verses.esv: 12:1 Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us,
verses.kjv: 1 Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
verses.niv: 1 Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles, and let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.

verses.esv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might, for there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in Sheol, to which you are going.
verses.kjv: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.niv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.

verses.esv:
3   The prudent sees danger and hides himself,
    but the simple go on and suffer for it.
verses.kjv: 3 A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
verses.niv: 3 A prudent man sees danger and takes refuge, but the simple keep going and suffer for it.

verses.esv:
9   Whoever is slack in his work
    is a brother to him who destroys.
verses.kjv: 9 He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.niv: 9 One who is slack in his work is brother to one who destroys.

verses.esv:
9   Honor the LORD with your wealth
    and with the firstfruits of all your produce;
verses.kjv: 9 Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
verses.niv: 9 Honor the LORD with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops;

verses.esv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain,
verses.kjv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain.
verses.niv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain.

verses.esv: 1:1 The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show to his servants the things that must soon take place. He made it known by sending his angel to his servant John,
verses.kjv: 1 The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass; and he sent and signified it by his angel unto his servant John:
verses.niv: 1 The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show his servants what must soon take place. He made it known by sending his angel to his servant John,

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv: 26 Look at the birds of the air: they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
verses.kjv: 26 Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.niv: 26 Look at the birds of the air; they do not sow or reap or store away in barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much more valuable than they?

verses.esv:
30   I passed by the field of a sluggard,
    by the vineyard of a man lacking sense,
31   and behold, it was all overgrown with thorns;
    the ground was covered with nettles,
    and its stone wall was broken down.
32   Then I saw and considered it;
    I looked and received instruction.
33   A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest,
34   and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
    and want like an armed man.
verses.kjv: 30 I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding; 31 And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down. 32 Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction. 33 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep: 34 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.
verses.niv: 30 I went past the field of the sluggard, past the vineyard of the man who lacks judgment; 31 thorns had come up everywhere, the ground was covered with weeds, and the stone wall was in ruins. 32 I applied my heart to what I observed and learned a lesson from what I saw: 33 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest- 34 and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.

verses.esv:
9   How long will you lie there, O sluggard?
    When will you arise from your sleep?
verses.kjv: 9 How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
verses.niv: 9 How long will you lie there, you sluggard? When will you get up from your sleep?
